Delete "principalAmount" property event, you will get the following exception.

It seems that if we are not using the same delimeter ("\n") as the source \r,
\r\n, or \n   we get this exception.

Looks like this bug is not necessarily caused by VE. Using Jigloo
(http://cloudgarden.com/jigloo/) with eclipse 3.0M8 on windows also gives the
same log. Looks like because jigloo generates a java file in unix format,
whatever platform you're on.

Yes, this is a new "sanity" check that the JavaEditor performs.  In any case, it
should be a good practice to use the same NL as the file is constructed with,
vs. the System's line feed property.


btw, there is a workaround to use JavaJets... by using a global static NL, and
using a jet directive for the NL to use it.  ... needing to sync. on this, and
maintain it per document..... XXXgenerators will have to lock, set, and drive
the template.

Sri, Gili: Do we still have a problem with this? I think you said that NL in
javajet is no longer hard-coded. If the problem is gone, we should close this
defect.
We are using the CodeFormatter prior to inserting this to the code
But does that mean this defect can be closed? Or that it is still valid?

EMF now has ability to set a custom NL. Though this particular problem is fixed,
we should make sure there is nothing left behind and fix it.
